page.title: 07Ecology of the Bromley Area
page.content: (Continued from the previous page) {Birds}(excluding water birds) Crows,rooks,wood pigeons,blackbirds, song thrushes,sparrows,wrens,robins, blue tits and great tits are common. Greenfinches,chaffinches,bullfinches, mistle thrushes,magpies,collared doves, coal tits,long-tailed tits,willow warblers,chiff-chaffs and spotted fly- catchers also nest in the area Swallows,swifts and house martins frequent the golf courses in summer. Lesser spotted,greater spotted and green woodpeckers,and jays nest in the wooded areas.Owls and kestrels are present.A small colony of ringed parakeets has been breeding in the area for ten years. {Amphibians} Frogs,toads and smooth newts are common and,in our pond,great crested newts have been found.
